quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to output "Welcome" if the value of the age variable is greater than 18.
[!raw!]
age = 42
{0} age > 18
  puts "Welcome"
{1}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]if Statements[/h1]

You can use an [b]if[/b] expression to execute code when a certain condition holds. 
If a conditional expression evaluates to [b]true[/b], the [b]if[/b] code is carried out. Otherwise, the code is ignored. 
[b]For example: [/b] [code format="rb" codeId="991"]a = 42
[b]
if[/b] a > 7
  puts "Yes"
[b]end[/b]

# outputs "Yes"[/code]
The condition a > 7 is evaluated. When it is [b]true[/b], the statements inside the [b]if[/b] are executed and the program outputs Yes. 
You can have multiple statements inside a single [b]if[/b] expression.
[note]The [b]end [/b]keyword is required to indicate the end of the [b]if[/b].[/note]

quizzes.question:
What is the output of this code?
num = 8
if num > 4
  puts "4"
  if num < 7
    puts "7"
    if num == 8
      puts "8"
    end
  end
end
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]if Statements[/h1]

[b]if[/b] expressions can be nested, one inside the other.
This means that the inner [b]if[/b]  is the code part of the outer one. This is one way to see whether multiple conditions are satisfied. Keep in mind that once an [b]if[/b] condition fails, the entire block is exited. [code format="rb" codeId="992"]num = 16
[b]if[/b] num > 7
  puts "Greater than 7"
  [b]if[/b] num < 42
    puts "Between 7 and 42"
  [b]end[/b]
[b]end[/b]
# outputs:
# Greater than 7
# Between 7 and 42[/code]
[note]Each [b]if[/b] has to have a corresponding [b]end[/b].[/note]
